page.title: 16VILLAGE HALL
page.content:
The former Souldrop{village school}was taken over as the village hall in 1971, the children in the village now going to Sharnbrook or Riseley for their schooling. The hall belongs to North Bedfordshire Council and is looked after by the Parish Hall Committee, the{trustees}being the parish council.
The front of the building carries the {village clock,}given to the village in 1911 by Sir Albert Bowen of Colworth Hall. The clock is of traditional construction driven by falling weights and is intended to run for a week without rewinding. The weight well has now been filled in so it currently runs for only 2\-days before rewinding. The village{post {office}is located at the side of the hall.
